description: An excellent, curvy font. Wide applications for logo and graphical design, but not for regular text, as it doesn't have lowercase letters.
title: Busorama

description: A very well done oriental font. Has a good width to it, so it can be used for logos or regular text.
title: Bonzai

description: One of my favorite fonts for text of all time - this font is very readable, and at the same time very stylish and fun. It has great letter support (supports uppercase, lower case, and special characters).
title: Dupree

description: Non-conservitive font good for graphical text. The orientation of the characters switches often, which can look good if used correctly.
title: Epsilon

description: Incredible font that looks like tag-art. This font is extremely well done and is very fun - I don't use it as often as I should.
title: Grand Stylus

description: I use this from time to time - the letters have nice width to them so this can be used for text effects, or for large lettering. It gets hard to read at smaller sizes.
title: Scissor Cuts

description: Very cool font that fades off to the right - that effect is built in. This works great for text that needs to look futuristic.
title: Shift

description: A good font that is constructed of squares, interesting for computer bitcode effects and other computer type looks.
title: Silkscreen

description: A grunge looking font that has good readability - this is one of the better grunge fonts I've seen.
title: Twang

description: A very fun and thick font useful for logo effects and cartoonish text.
title: Under Attack
